result.execSummary:
The defendant Dakota S Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.
-Court will grant expungement after one year, with no further criminal conviction and payment of all monies.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dakota S Olson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: After 1 year-Court will grant expungement after one year, with no further criminal conviction and payment of all monies.

11:58 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with a fine and costs.  State concurs.  Atty Roeth concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty as charged.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to: 

-$100 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

-Court will grant expungement after one year, with no further criminal conviction and payment of all monies.

Court adjourned at 12:05 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 1, 2016 at 11:30 am.

2:27 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - we have an offer that the defendant will accept but requests a little more time.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on November 1, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:28 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

2:31 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Joey Roeth present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - requests this matter be set for plea & sentencing.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on September 27, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:32 p.m.

Status hearing on July 18, 2016 at 10:30 am.

11:17 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Defendant stands mute.  Court enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  Court notes bond has been set.  Court will set for Status Hearing on July 18, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:18 a.m.

9:20 a.m. No Appearance by the defendant.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders a warrant - stayed for ten days.

Court adjourned at 9:20 a.m.
Defendant is to have no violent contact with Travis S.
Defendant appeared by video from Green Lake County Jail.
Defendant is to have no violent contact with Travis S.

2:25 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  DA Christenson makes bond recommendation.  Court orders $500 signature bond and condition of:  Defendant is to have no violent contact with Travis S.  Defendant to appear for Initial Appearance on July 5, 2016 at 8:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 2:25 p.m.
*PROCESSING COMPLETE*
